resources.string: Minimum 4 players. \nPlay will rotate with a different player as the "describer" each turn and the rest as "drawers". The describer will study an image silently for a short time, then describe the image to the drawers without looking at the image. During this time, the drawers should attempt to recreate the image being described to them. Drawers may ask the describer questions. When time is up, drawers show their drawings. The describer should privately mark the player who\'s image they believe to be most correct BEFORE looking at the image again. Then, everyone may see the original image and drawers privately vote for which drawing besides their own is the most accurate. Scoring: the player the describer chose gets 1 point. The player with the most drawer votes gets 1 point (each get one if there is a tie). If the player with the most drawer votes is also the one chosen by the describer, give a point to the describer for giving an accurate description. Rotate describer and hit "Play Again".
